intro: Sphaerocionium undulatum, commonly known as the undulating globular moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Ptilidiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form, with small, overlapping leaves that are often undulated in appearance. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions on rocks or soil. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short stalks and release spores when mature. Sphaerocionium undulatum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitat for various invertebrates.
